moves.1... d6 2. d4: I will always take the centre when possible
moves.2... e6 3. b4: I am developing my game a little so at this point I would have brought out a piece from the back row, at this stage I still liked the pawn game to open with
moves.3... c6 4. b5: this allows me to attack the king and put constrain bigger pieces
moves.6. Qd3: there might have been better options here than the queen
moves.7... Qxd7: that evened things but I still prefer the two white pawns position in the middle of the board
moves.8. Nf3 Nc6 9. O-O: a little defensive when I could have kept up the pressure but nothing particularly wrong
moves.9... Nge7: now his back row is starting to open up with ke7
moves.10. Re1: I like to have the middle pawns backed up by rooks and/or queen in this type of position
moves.11. Bb2: Bb2 it looks prettier than it is effective
moves.11... Nb4: bit of pressure applied by kb4
moves.12. Qb3: defensive move but still provides plenty of attacking options
moves.12... a5: pawn to put pressure on the queen
moves.13... f5 14. Ba3: not sure why he did not push pawn to a4 here?
moves.17... Nd8: sensible defence covering he pressure on e6
moves.18... Nxe6 19. Bxb4: Bb4 this move is to open up his queen to attack by my rooks
moves.23... Rd8 24. Nd5+: this Kd5 move could have been made earlier but is still a decent move
moves.24... Ke8 25. Nc7+: what a knight sacrifice, why would I do that?
moves.27... Ke6: king left with little option here
moves.28. Ng5+: I smell blood kg5 forces king to e5
moves.28... Ke5 29. Qd4#: mate, very pleased with this game but reviewing it there was several things I could have done sooner, still great fun
